How do you like this script?

For troubleshooting Teams issues, it is recommended to generate fresh Teams Debug Logs first. See: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-desktop/troubleshoot-teams#collect-teams-logs
To generate these debug logs, open the affected Teams app (using the same user account/context as for this data collection) and press CTRL+ALT+SHIFT+1 within Teams. Teams will generate diagnostic logs which can be collected by this script.
If you already have these logs or do not need them, select 'Retry' to continue. Otherwise select 'Cancel', generate the Teams debug logs and start the data collection again.

Usage guide:
Step 1: Select the context/environment in which the machine(s) are used:
AVD - Azure Virtual Desktop RDS - Remote Desktop Services or direct (non-AVD/non-W365) RDP connection W365 - Windows 365 Cloud PC
Step 2: Select the role of the machine(s) in the given context/environment:
Source - Source machine from where you connect to other machines using a Remote Desktop client Target - Target machine to which you connect to or a server with any RDS role installed
Step 3: [Optional] If you selected 'AVD' or 'W365', enter one or more computer names (NetBIOS or FQDN) in the 'Computer(s)' field from where you want to collect data. The name of the local computer is used as the default value. If multiple machines are specified, separate them with a semicolon. The data will be collected from each computer in a sequential order.
For data collection:
Step 4a: [Optional] Select one or more available scenarios:
Profiles - Collect data for troubleshooting 'User Profiles' issues Activation - Collect data for troubleshooting 'OS Licensing/Activation' issues MSRA - Collect data for troubleshooting 'Remote Assistance' issues SCard - Collect data for troubleshooting 'Smart Card' issues IME - Collect data for troubleshooting 'Input Method' issues Teams - Collect data for troubleshooting 'Teams Media Optimization' issues (AVD/W365 only) MSIXAA - Collect data for troubleshooting 'MSIX App Attach' issues (AVD only) HCI - Collect data for troubleshooting 'Azure Stack HCI' issues (AVD only) DumpPID - Collect a Process Dump of an existing process NetTrace - Collect a network trace (netsh) DiagOnly - Generate a Diagnostics report only
Step 5a: Click the 'Start' button when ready. Data collection/diagnostics may take up to several minutes.
For live diagnostics:
Step 4b: Select the 'LiveDiag' option.
Step 5b: Select the desired diagnostics category tab.
Step 6: Click on the desired button within the selected tab to run the coresponding diagnostics check.
Running diagnostics. This can take up to a few minutes. Please wait...

The script will attempt to collect data remotely by copying itself to the C:\MS_DATA\ folder on each specified machine and running from there.

If you select 'Yes,' you may be prompted to enter credentials for each of the remote machines separately. Please provide an account with administrative permissions on the remote machine (preferably a Domain Admin if the machine is domain-joined).
Please note that currently, any changes made in the 'Configure data collection' or 'Configure diagnostics' options for filtering do not apply to remote data collection or diagnostics.

The AVD Windows Desktop client (MSRDC) is currently running on this machine. To capture the latest Windows Desktop client-specific ETL trace(s), it is necessary to close the MSRDC.exe process.
Would you like to close MSRDC.exe now?
If you choose 'Yes', the MSRDC.exe process will be terminated, disconnecting all outgoing MSRDC connections and the script will continue with the data collection.
If you choose 'No', the MSRDC.exe process will persist, and the script will continue with the data collection, but will not be able to collect the most recent ETL trace(s).
If you choose 'Cancel', data collection will be aborted.
MSRDC.exe has been closed. The script will wait for 20 seconds before continuing, to allow the latest RD client ETL trace data to be saved.
MSRDC.exe has not been closed. The most recent RD client ETL trace data will NOT be available for troubleshooting! Continuing data collection.
